description.value:
The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d10 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d6 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} and aware of it must succeed on a [[/save wis 24 format=long]] or become &Reference[frightened]{frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} uses one of the following breath weapons.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} exhales &Reference[fire]{fire} in a 90-foot &Reference[cone]{cone}. Each creature in that area must make a [[/save dex 24 format=long]], taking [[/damage 13d10 type=fire average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} exhales gas in a 90-foot &Reference[cone]{cone}. Each creature in that area must succeed on a [[/save str 24 format=long]] or have disadvantage on Strength-based attack rolls, &Reference[str]{Strength} checks, and &Reference[str]{Strength} saving throws for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} magically polymorphs into a &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} or &Reference[beast]{beast} that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and &Reference[int]{Intelligence}, &Reference[wis]{Wisdom}, and &Reference[cha]{Charisma} scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Lair Actions

On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can’t use the same effect two rounds in a row:

  • The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} glimpses the future, so it has advantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws until initiative count 20 on the next round.
  • One creature the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can see within 120 feet of it must succeed on a [[/save cha 15 format=long]] or be banished to a dream plane, a different plane of existence the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} has imagined into being. To escape, the creature must use its action to make a &Reference[cha]{Charisma} check contested by the dragon’s. If the creature wins, it escapes the dream plane. Otherwise, the effect ends on initiative count 20 on the next round. When the effect ends, the creature reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that one is occupied.
The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Regional Effects

The region containing a legendary gold dragon’s lair is warped by the dragon’s magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

  • Whenever a creature that can understand a language sleeps or enters a state of trance or reverie within 6 miles of the dragon’s lair, the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can establish telepathic contact with that creature and converse with it in its dreams. The creature remembers its conversation with the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} upon waking.
  • Banks of beautiful, opalescent mist manifest within 6 miles of the dragon’s lair. The mist doesn’t obscure anything. It assumes haunting forms when evil creatures are near the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} or other non-evil creatures in the mist, warning such creatures of the danger.
  • Gems and pearls within 1 mile of the dragon’s lair sparkle and gleam, shedding dim light in a 5-foot radius.

If the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} dies, these effects end immediately.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

A Gold Dragon’s Lair

Gold dragons make their homes in out-of-the-way places, where they can do as they please without arousing suspicion or fear. Most dwell near idyllic lakes and rivers, mist-shrouded islands, cave complexes hidden behind sparkling waterfalls, or ancient ruins.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Detect. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) check.

Tail Attack. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes a tail attack.

Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions). The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} must succeed on a [[/save dex 25 format=long]] or take [[/damage 2d6 + 10 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage and be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can then fly up to half its flying speed.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) check.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} must succeed on a [[/save dex 25 format=long]] or take [[/damage 2d6 + 10 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage and be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can then fly up to half its flying speed.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Amphibious. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can breathe air and water.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
